qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the SCS25 live webcasts and videos?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of the SCS25 live webcasts and videos is to allow people who cannot attend the event in Pittsburgh, PA to still be part of the celebration.
qa_list.ref_chunk:
Skip to main content

Events

25 Things

History

Video

SCS25 Live Webcasts and Videos

Can't join us in Pittsburgh for SCS25? You can still be part of the celebration with our live webcasts of the keynote and panel discussions. Videos of the presentations will be available here immediately following the live webcast.

SCS25 Kickoff: A Conversation with Serkan Piantino (CS'04), Facebook New York

Part of the 25th anniversary celebration of Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science, October 10, 2014 in Pittsburgh, PA.

SCS25: Robotics at the Tipping Point

Moderated by Howie Choset, Professor, Robotics Institute

Part of the 25th anniversary celebration of Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science, October 11, 2014 in Pittsburgh, PA.

SCS25: The Next 25 Years of Computer Science

Moderated by Peter Lee, Corporate Vice President, Microsoft Research

Part of the 25th anniversary celebration of Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science, October 11, 2014 in Pittsburgh, PA.

Back to top

qa_list.question: When was the 25th anniversary celebration of Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science?
qa_list.answer: The 25th anniversary celebration took place on October 10 and 11, 2014 in Pittsburgh, PA.

qa_list.question: Who moderated the 'SCS25: Robotics at the Tipping Point' panel discussion?
qa_list.answer: The panel discussion was moderated by Howie Choset, a professor from the Robotics Institute.
